instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Found short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. Cleared the shot , still 5v no current. 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is present
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is present 
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA</SIGNAL> is present 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> is present 
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> is 5v
No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
Pls help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is present
--------------------
No <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>"
Are you really sure?
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> power supply is powered from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, trough <RESISTOR>R5430</RESISTOR>.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Check first diode mode to ground there; compare with good board.

Post <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Resistance 405
Pin 23 -12.31v
Pin 22-3.3v
Pin 12- 0.00v
Pin13-0.00
Pin29-0.00v
Pin 21-0.00

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Really strange to get any voltage at L7690, with 0V at pin 21.

Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message: Can <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> be the problem, because I met some flux around it, probably the technical reflowed it before it got to me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message: <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> should be good, if you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message: Check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present; the small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message: No voltages on any coil around pm <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Check for short on these coils.

Do you get correct <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> for sure?
If yes, check LDO voltages from page 64.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Compare <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> LDOs with good board.
Try changing <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
I replaced <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.
Itâ€™s drawing 20v now. But itâ€™s not coming up
The current on the amp meter goes back to zero.
Working around
I found out the some of the coils around the pmic voltages are fluctuating
Like
PVDDCPUAWAKE_SW1/SW2/SW3
The voltage on most of the coils are fluctuating
                      Thermal camera
T2 is getting warm
Then there is a Pulse on <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> after 2sec.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Need to get stable <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> first.
Is that your case?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> are stable. Is the voltages around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> are going up and down.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground readings on <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> coils with good board.
Do the same for all big coils too.

Reflow <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, in case didn't solder properly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20v
